label: A4B12C3_oC76_63_eg_fg2h_cf-001
title: $\beta$-Bi$_{4}$V$_{2}$O$_{11}$ Structure
comments:
There are three known varieties of Bi$_{4}$V$_{2}$O$_{11}$ (Villars, 2018): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B9C2_mC112_5_6c_2a2b16c_4c-001}{$\alpha$}, the ground state structure, stable up to $450^{\circ}$C, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B12C3_oC76_63_eg_fg2h_cf-001}{$\beta$}, stable between $450^{\circ}$C and $555^{\circ}$C (this structure), and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A5B9C2_tI64_139_em_d2n_h-001}{$\gamma$}, stable from 555$^{\circ}$C up to the melting point at 880$^{\circ}$C. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The data for this structure was taken at 550$^{\circ}$C. 
 Several of the Wyckoff positions listed here are only partially occupied:  V-I: 25\%, V-II: 50\%, and O-IV 75\%. 
 (Mairesee, 2003) describe this structure in the $Amam$ setting of space group \#63.  We used FINDSYM to transform this to the standard $Cmcm$ setting.
